meanings.sent1: The suppled fabric draped elegantly over the chair.
meanings.sent2: Her suppled muscles allowed her to bend with ease.
meanings.sent3: The suppled rubber band bounced playfully on the desk.
meanings.sent4: His suppled mind could easily adapt to new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The suppled tree branches swayed gracefully in the wind.

meanings.sent1: She suppled the leather by gently stretching it.
meanings.sent2: He suppled his body through daily yoga practice.
meanings.sent3: The dancer suppled her movements to flow seamlessly.
meanings.sent4: Time and effort can supple even the stiffest materials.
meanings.sent5: The warm-up exercises helped supple their muscles before the game.

meanings.definition: To make or become more flexible or adaptable
meanings.sent1: The training program suppled his approach to problem-solving.
meanings.sent2: She suppled her schedule to accommodate the new project.
meanings.sent3: The team suppled their strategy to counter the opponent's moves.
meanings.sent4: Experience can supple one's mindset to embrace change.
meanings.sent5: The negotiation skills workshop aimed to supple their communication styles.
